com.jaxws.json.packet.handler
Interface Encoder

public interface Encoder

Author:
Sundaramurthi Saminathan Encoder interface allows user to create different output format other than JSON. Class implements Encoder can act as custom responder.

Method Summary
 com.sun.xml.ws.api.pipe.ContentType encode(com.sun.xml.ws.api.message.Packet packet, java.io.OutputStream output)
          Called when user request accept content type with is supported by MIME type returned in contentType call.
 com.sun.xml.ws.api.pipe.ContentType getStaticContentType(com.sun.xml.ws.api.message.Packet packet)
          Static content type returned by encoder.
 java.lang.String mimeContent()
           
 

Method Detail

mimeContent

java.lang.String mimeContent()
Returns:
any valid MIME type. mime content response matched with wsdl mime:content value. If wsdl mime match with encoder mime then this encoder instance used for out put rendering. If your like to customize JSON content type look at JSONObjectCustomizer.

getStaticContentType

com.sun.xml.ws.api.pipe.ContentType getStaticContentType(com.sun.xml.ws.api.message.Packet packet)
Static content type returned by encoder. If null content type returned by encoder implementation, response content buffered and "encode" method returned content type used as content type header.

Parameters:
packet -
Returns:

encode

com.sun.xml.ws.api.pipe.ContentType encode(com.sun.xml.ws.api.message.Packet packet,
                                           java.io.OutputStream output)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Called when user request accept content type with is supported by MIME type returned in contentType call.

Parameters:
packet -
output - (Most case direct servlet output stream)
Returns:
content type of response.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - WARN: returned content type ignored in current version, due to content not buffered.
